Summary: Falling star that becomes larger, and ends with 9 "points" or "stars"
trends: There have been 24 other sightings in North Myrtle Beach
There were no other sightings in North Myrtle Beach on or around August 26th 2007
divs: sighting detailson the month of august (approximately 26th) of 2007, my husband and i witnessed a falling star that grew larger as it travelled closer to us; over the shoreline and just to the front of us, the "star" stopped, produced a star on each side (becoming 3) and the outer "stars" moved slightly below the first star, and also "sprouted" two more stars of their own, thus showing a total of 9 "stars." after just a few seconds, but long enough to be sure of what we were witnessing, as one unit they moved upward and vanished into the clear night skies. the color was white\gold, and each was connected to a somewhat "sparkling" cord. i have just recently discovered that a menorah can have 9 points. it looked to be that: a menorah. my husband, who is retired from the police profession and always very skeptical, saw what i saw. i don't know what my husband felt, but i felt as if the star was going to "land" on us where we were sitting. i began to move my beach chair at that point (i thought to get out of its way), when it just stopped, and began to develop as i've described above.when it all disappeared up into the skies, i asked my husband, "did you see that?" "yes," he said. we were both very surprised and puzzled.
